summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons press release announcing the death of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein. He was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI is investigating the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide. He was under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.
The incident was described as an 'apparent suicide' by the Bureau of Prisons.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead by hospital staff.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein had arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
